name: Hit Points
description: Represents the amount of damage a character can take before falling unconscious or dying.

name: Morale
description: Represents the mental fortitude and morale of the character, determining their ability to resist fear and intimidation.

name: Reaction
description: Determines how quickly a character reacts to perceived threats and player commands. A higher Reaction stat results in a smaller reaction time.

name: Walking Speed
description: Determines how fast a character can walk. Higher Agility results in faster walking speed, measured in meters per second (m/s).

name: Running Speed
description: Determines how fast a character can run. Higher Agility results in faster running speed, measured in meters per second (m/s).

name: Carry Weight
description: Determines how much weight a character can carry comfortably on their back. Higher Strength results in greater carrying capacity, measured in kilograms (kg).

name: Awareness
description: Represents the character's ability to notice details and detect hidden objects or creatures. Higher Perception increases awareness.

name: Evasion
description: Determines how effectively a character can avoid attacks. Higher Reflexes result in better evasion.

name: Melee Bonus
description: Represents the bonus damage a character deals in melee combat. Higher Strength increases melee damage.
